bug.short_desc: JS Global Built-ins ('alert', 'console', ...) Depend on Target Environment

long_desc.thetext:
Dependencies of classes are matched against a list of "built-in globals", global symbols that are believed to be part of the runtime environment the code is targeted to run in. They are supposed to be available automatically at runtime.
For the longest time this set of built-ins was targeted at browser runtimes (sometimes generalizing symbols that are only supported in some of them). But with the advent of other runtimes (nodejs, webworkers, ...), I think we need runtime-specific built-in lists. Nodejs has "console" and "process", Rhino has "environment" but not "alert", mobile platforms might have still others, asf.
The correct list of built-ins could be picked by skeleton, e.g. 'desktop' skeleton uses the browser-specific list, 'server' skeleton uses a nodejs/rhino list, etc. Additionally, this could be tailored by a generator configuration key, like TARGET_ENVIRONMENT (being one of ['browser', 'server', 'mobile'] or similar).
